item.title: Hello World
item.description: “Hello World!” is overused. The first lesson in every introductory programming class revolves around printing this simple statement to the terminal. In Python: print("Hello World!") In Java: System.out.println("Hello World!"); In C++: std::cout << "Hello World!"; In Haskell: main :: IO() main = putStrLn "Hello World!" This may be disquieting: that the entrypoint to a field once permeated with “hacker culture” and strong anti-institutionalist vibes has been standardized for the sake of tradition.
